intro: Tephrosia dolichocarpa, commonly known as the long pod tephrosia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume-like pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces elongated, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Tephrosia dolichocarpa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
